Legal_Issue: Reviewable error in assessment of refugee claim
Application_Error: Alleged failure to address risks to failed claimants, burden of proof language
Assessment_Standard: Reasonableness for findings of fact and credibility; correctness for questions of law
Evidence_Ignored: Alleged lack of consideration of risks to returning failed claimants
Legal_Standard: Standard of review: reasonableness and correctness
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness for factual findings, correctness for legal questions
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA sections 96, 97, and principles from Federal Court jurisprudence
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility in applicant's testimony and supporting evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility of personal testimony, sufficiency of country condition evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Alleged procedural unfairness in burden of proof statement
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in applicant's account, implausibility of claims
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board's credibility assessment and use of burden of proof
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Canadian jurisprudence on standard of review
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review application in judicial review
Omission_Type: Failure to explicitly address certain risk factors
